channel.title: Posts on The Median Duck
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on The Median Duck

item.title: Series 20, Bonus Content: All Tied Up
item.description: Your Task The Actual Tiebreaker Controversy Resolving the Controversy with Alternative Tiebreakers ‚Ä¶Comes With More Controversy What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task Ba-Ba-Bonus Content and Task!!! Provide alternative series tiebreakers to the one that was actually used for the Series 20 Tiebreaker. Where possible, provide the alternative champions as a result of these alternative tiebreakers. Figure 1: Fancy seeing you here for some bonus content! The Actual Tiebreaker Controversy In Series 20, Episode 10, there was a 3-way tie for the series championship between the holy trinity of Ania, Maisie and Phil.

item.title: Series 20, Episode 10: A Swashbuckling Series Finale
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors One Episode Ahead Prediction Retrospective What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task We‚Äôre at the end of series; the blog post tasks have changed! Review your one episode ahead prediction for Series 20 of Taskmaster; that is the prediction for episode 10 and the final Series 20 outcome, based on observations up to and include Episode 9. Quantify the probability for the variety of extraordinary events we witnessed.

item.title: Series 20, Episode 9: The Ultimate Pen
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task We are at the ultimate pen of the series! You know the drill by now; generate the usual ranking distributions (marginal, joint, within-episode, end of series), and comparisons to prior week‚Äôs distributions and predictions. Bonus points for actually publishing this commentary ahead of the broadcast of the series finale.

item.title: Series 20, Episode 8: The Art of Doing Nothing
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task We‚Äôre on the final stretch of episodes of Series 20! There are only 2 more episodes to go! You know the drill by now; generate the usual ranking distributions (marginal, joint, within-episode, end of series), and comparisons to prior week‚Äôs distributions and predictions. Bonus points for actually publishing this commentary ahead of the broadcast of Episode 9.

Bonus points for actually publishing this commentary ahead of the broadcast of Episode 8. Figure 1: Making a mouth watering entrance in the flesh.

item.title: Series 20, Episode 6: The Egg-istential Crisis
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions Score! Some Stimulation from the Existing Simulations What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task You know the drill by now! Generate the usual ranking distributions (marginal, joint, within-episode, end of series), and comparisons to prior week‚Äôs distributions and predictions. Bonus points for providing additional stimulation from your existing simulations. Figure 1: Making my statement entrance to this week‚Äôs commentary!

item.title: Series 20, Episode 5: The Not Quite Median (Duck)
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions Sidebar: An Honest Conversation at the Table What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task We‚Äôre at the midway point of the series! Generate the usual ranking distributions (marginal, joint, within-episode, end of series), and comparisons to prior week‚Äôs distributions and predictions. Bonus points for comparing the estimated within episode ranking distributions to their empirical counterparts based on observed episode rankings to date.

item.title: Series 20, Episode 4: Let's Franchise This Baby
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task Using the latest data of Series 20 UK Taskmaster (up to Episode 4), generate ranking distributions for the cast of this series. Ranking distributions should be for within-episode and end-of-series placement, and the joint distribution for the full cast. Bonus points for commenting on how how these distributions have changed since the last episode (Episode 3).

item.title: Series 20, Episode 3: The Unnecessary Trilogy
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task Using the latest data of Series 20 UK Taskmaster (up to Episode 3), generate ranking distributions for the cast of this series. Ranking distributions should be for within-episode and end-of-series placement, and the joint distribution for the full cast. Bonus points for commenting on how how these distributions have changed since the last episode (Episode 2).

item.title: Series 20, Episode 2: The Disappointing Sequel
item.description: Your Task Series Scores on the Doors Within-Episode Ranking Distributions End-of-Series Ranking Distributions Joint Cast Ranking Distributions What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task Using the latest data of Series 20 UK Taskmaster (up to Episode 2), generate ranking distributions for each contestant. Ranking distributions should be for within-episode and end-of-series placement, and the joint distribution for the full cast. Bonus points for commenting on how how these distributions have changed since the last episode (Episode 1).

item.title: Series 20, Episode 1: Soft Reboot
item.description: Your Task Let‚Äôs Start this Chase: New Cast ‚Ä¶ Same Sort of Analysis What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task Using task data up to and including Episode 1 of Series 20 of Taskmaster UK, generate ranking distributions for each contestant. Ranking distributions should be for within-episode and end-of-series. Bonus points for generating a joint ranking distribution for the full cast of Series 20. Let‚Äôs Start this Chase: New Cast ‚Ä¶ Same Sort of Analysis Figure 1: Let‚Äôs Start this Series 20 Chase!

item.title: Series 19 Retrospecive Part 2: The Qrstuv-ies
item.description: Your Task For the tl;dr generation‚Ä¶.and the Winners are And Here Are My Workings‚Ä¶ What Have we Learnt Today? Your Task Host the inaugral Qrstuv-ies, an unofficial data-driven Taskmaster Awards ceremony which celebrates the latest series of UK Taskmaster. What‚Äôs your Favourite Season? ‚Ä¶ Mine is the Awards Season For the tl;dr generation‚Ä¶.and the Winners are Figure 1: Series 19 Qrstuv-ies Winners And Here Are My Workings‚Ä¶ Your Average and Standard (Deviation) Statistical Analysis Table 2 shows overall summary statistics for the points awarded for each contestants task attempt across the series.

item.title: Series 19 Retrospective Part 1: Sharing the Same Juice
item.description: Your Task The Current Timeline The Prophet Nick Mohammed What Have We Learnt Today? Your Task With Series 19 having concluded, compare the predictions that were made on Series 19 outcomes (final series contestant rankings, series points accrued by each contestant) with the actual outcomes (those at the end of episode 10 and the end of the series). The aforementioned Series 19 predictions were discussed in a prior post. These predictions were made using data up to and including Episode 9 of Series 19, on for standings at the end of the series (after Episode 10).

item.title: Series-ly, Take a Chance on Me
item.description: Your Task Previously on The Median Duck‚Ä¶ The Ultimate Pen ‚Ä¶ is the Penultimate Series-ly, What‚Äôs the Situation? What Have We Learnt Today? üí° The majority of this post was written before I had watched the Series 19 finale. My results and insights are driven purely from data up to Episode 9, I have not cheated in any way! Your Task For each contestant of the Series 19 of UK Taskmater, generate probability distributions on their series rank.

item.title: May the Odds Be In Your Favour
item.description: Your Task A New Dawn, A New Dataset The Observed Reality Timeline Approach (ORT) The Multiverse Approach (MV) What Have We Learnt Today Your Task For each contestant of the Series 19 of UK Taskmater, generate probability distributions on their ranking in an episode. For example, estimate the probability of Fatiha-El Ghorri placing 1st, 2nd, 3rd, 4th and 5th in an episode of Series 19. A New Dawn, A New Dataset With Series 19 well underway (at time of writing, Episode 8 ‚ÄúScience all your life‚Äù has just broadcasted), and a potential lag in the data being supplied to TdlM database1, it is time to take data matters into our own piano capable hands.

item.title: The Elephant in the Room
item.description: The Elephant The Room: Series 19 Opinion (so far) The Elephant Hello. It‚Äôs been a while and I apologise to my single digit audience for my absence. I would love to say that I had a good excuse for my absence, but the truth is rather more boring than that. However, it‚Äôs time embrace the free time the I have regained and reignite this (passion) project. The simple truth is that the Board volunteer position I held for the Housing Association associated with my condominium (a flat for UK readers) took over a significant proportion of my time and energy.

item.title: The Taskmaster Swear Cloud Appreciation Society
item.description: Your Task Making it Rain‚Ä¶ with Data The Overall Swear Forecast The Series Swear Forecast Getting My Head out of the Clouds, and Going to the Bar. What Have we Learnt Today? This post contains strong lanuage‚Ä¶reader discretion advised! And this time, I really mean it‚Ä¶ Your Task Create a swear word cloud which is fit for the Cloud Appreciation Society. Making it Rain‚Ä¶ with Data We continue to use the profanity based queries we have developed in the following posts (Foulest Mouth of Them All, The Taskmaster‚Äôs Potty Mouth).

item.title: The Taskmaster's Potty Mouth
item.description: Your Task The Profanity Rate Approach Case of the Missing Profanities Putting on a Spread To Mean or Median‚Ä¶ What Have We Learnt Today? üí° Warning This Post Contains Strong Language...Reader Discretion is advised! Your Task Find out whether the Taskmaster (Greg Davies) has become more or less foul mouth over time. This post is an extension of this profanity based post. The Profanity Rate Approach One way to answer our question is to use Profanity Rate that we previously defined in the aforementioned post.

item.title: The Foulest Mouth of Them All
item.description: Your Task Profanity Insanity The Foulest Mouth of Them All‚Ä¶ What Have We Learnt Today? üí° Warning This Post Contains Strong Language...Reader Discretion is advised! Your Task Find the foulest mouthed contestant in UK Taskmaster to date. Bonus points for finding the foulest mouth in each series. A Side Amble in the Preamble In the spirit of good code practices, namely avoiding duplicating code and centralising common code into a single location were possible, here is a set of preamble scripts that I will be sourcing at the beginning of each post.

item.title: A Data Dic(tionary) pic of TdlM
item.description: Your Task Don‚Äôt be a Data Dic (tionary) about this‚Ä¶ Summary of Findings Final Thoughts Appendix Details Your Task Obtain a good overview of the tables in the TdLM database, what these tables contain, how these tables are linked together, and which ones are the most important for this project. Don‚Äôt be a Data Dic (tionary) about this‚Ä¶ This article assumes that you are able to connect to the TdlM database successfully (database connection post).

item.title: Sidenote: Musings on TdlM
item.description: Sidenote Introduction Data Quality Why This Datasource? Potential Articles to Explore in the Future Sidenote Introduction A few remarks and musings on the Trabajo de las Mesas database (TdlM). Data Quality As with any analysis and modelling project, the insights and conclusions generated are only as good as the data supplied to it. I do not know the specifics regarding how this data is collated and reviewed (my intention is that there will be a future article dedicated to this), but believe the data is inputted by fellow (hardcore) Taskmaster fans from taskmaster.

item.title: Strength in Data: Connecting to the Taskmaster Database
item.description: Your Task Successfully connect to the Taskmaster database from within R. Fastest wins; your time starts now! This article provides an overview of Trabajo de las Mesas, a pivotal database that will be central to this project. The article will also provide guidance on how to connect to the database from within R. Trabajo de las Mesas Database Trabajo de las Mesas (TdlM 1) provides a plethora of data associated with Taskmaster in a database format.
